title: Do computers need rest time? - Quora

response.answer_text: Actually, power cycles are to be avoided, if that’s what you mean by “rest time”. Mostly electronics tend to function better if you don’t turn them off and on a lot. I’ve had and have computers [most built by me] that have been on for years. As long as you keep the environment as cool as possible and the individual components are well cooled there should be no problems with leaving them on all of the time. Further, I’ve had so called “server grade” components break down more often than “consumer grade” parts, perhaps because they get more stress do to more intense use because they are being “pounded” by many more users. Those are just my experiences.

Depends what the computer components were built to do. Most consumer computer parts weren’t designed to run full power all the time. This is why workstation components are available. The service life of a consumer computer will be greatly diminished if running full power all the time. However, server grade components are much more stable over longer duty cycles.

Typically a computer that is always on will last longer than one turned off daily. Each power cycle causes a little stress to components from power just being applied in addition to a cycle of expansion and contraction due to heating/cooling, whereas a constantly running machine will not suffer from the cycle.
Hope not. Mines been running for over 2 years non stop except for the occasional reboot, or shut down to blow out the case.
